Name: Information Systems Concentration
Constraints: Please refer to the IS_Concentration.json file
Allowed_Courses: Please refer to the IS_Concentration.json file

Name: Information Systems General Education (GenEd) - Foundations - Communication - Pathway 1
Constraints: Take two of the three allowed courses (total 9 units) and required in Year 1
Description: Communication is the process of gathering, organizing and conveying information and ideas. Our students will learn how to communicate through various means and grow in their ability to be coherent, concise and persuasive.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Communication - Pathway 2
Constraints: Take one of the two allowed courses(9 units) and required in Year 1
Description: Communication is the process of gathering, organizing and conveying information and ideas. Our students will learn how to communicate through various means and grow in their ability to be coherent, concise and persuasive.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Data Analysis
Constraints: Take all of the allowed courses(9 units) and required in Year 1
Description: Data Analysis focuses on how to make statistical decisions and inferences from data. Students will learn how to collect, analyze and ethically communicate findings to a general audience.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Computational Thinking
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3
Description: Computational Thinking focuses on problem-solving using information technologies and computation, including hands-on experience with computer programs and consideration of their societal impact.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Contextual Thinking
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3
Description: Contextual Thinking is the ability to explore the circumstances and history surrounding an issue or event, understanding why and how problems persist and what solutions have been attempted.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Intercultural and Global Enquiry
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3
Description: Intercultural and Global Inquiry develops cultural awareness and the ability to interpret the world through both personal and external perspectives.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Foundations - Scientific Enquiry
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3
Description: Scientific Inquiry involves critically evaluating the scientific process—from hypothesis generation through experimental design to data analysis—and understanding its societal impact and limitations.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Disciplinary Perspectives - Humanities
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and required in Year 1
Description: The Humanities introduce students to human culture and society via analytic and critical methods, expanding their ability to examine problems socially, politically, and morally.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Disciplinary Perspectives - Social Sciences
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and required in Year 1
Description: The Social Sciences explore causes and consequences of behavior through analytical and mathematical models, helping students understand individual and societal phenomena.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Disciplinary Perspectives - The Arts
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed anytime during undergraduate career
Description: The Arts build interpretive and perceptual skills, preparing students to understand and share culture and to enrich their lives through artistic expression.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Disciplinary Perspectives - Logic/Mathematical Reasoning
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed anytime during undergraduate career
Description: Logic/Mathematical Reasoning develops the ability to form arguments supported by evidence and respond to counterclaims meaningfully.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Disciplinary Perspectives - Additional Disciplines(Business, Design, Engineering)
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed anytime during undergraduate career
Description: Students choose one course in Business, Design, or Engineering to explore tools for solving complex problems within those fields.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Special Seminars - Grand Challenge Seminar
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and required in Year 1
Description: First-year students take a seminar on real, complex global problems (e.g., sustainability, equity) taught by multidisciplinary faculty teams.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Special Seminars - Perspectives on Justice and Injustice
Constraints: Take at least 9 units worth of courses from allowed courses and can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3
Description: Courses examine inequalities that lead to or result from injustice, exploring which inequalities we are ethically obligated to combat and how to do so.

Name: Information Systems General Education - Experiential Learning Activity - Experiential Learning Activity
Constraints: Beginning with the class of 2028, each student must complete and reflect on at least one activity
Description: Apply classroom learning in real-world settings (e.g., internships, research, study abroad, community engagement) with reflection built in.
